About Ohana Mana Koa

Ohana Mana Koa is a Native Hawaiian–owned and veteran-led 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to empowering Native Hawaiian families, veterans, and underserved communities through culturally grounded programs that foster education, economic mobility, and resilience.

Our Story

Founded on the principles of Aloha and Kuleana, our organization bridges traditional Hawaiian values with modern community needs. We believe in the power of cultural identity to heal, strengthen, and unite our people.

Through our veteran leadership and deep community roots, we create programs that honor our ancestors while building pathways to prosperity for future generations.

Our Core Values

K

Kuleana

Taking responsibility for our community and future generations

A

Aloha

Love, compassion, and respect in all our interactions

P

Pono

Righteousness and doing what is morally right

Our Leadership

Wendy Nolan

President & CEO

As the founder and mission leader of Ohana Mana Koa, Wendy is a dedicated Native Hawaiian woman and veteran committed to empowering her community.

Moses Nolan

Director of Ops & Finance

A Native Hawaiian and Wendy’s son, Moses oversees the daily operations and financial stewardship of the organization, ensuring its long-term sustainability.

Johnathon Thompson

Director of Cultural Stewardship

As Wendy’s brother, Johnathon provides essential cultural guidance and advisory support, ensuring all programs are grounded in Native Hawaiian values.

Eric Jefferson

Director of Strategic Development

With a sharp business acumen, Eric drives the strategic growth and governance of the organization, focusing on sustainable development and SBA compliance.

Empowering Native Hawaiian families, veterans, and underserved communities through culturally grounded programs.
